results.title: Falling cats
results.creator_credit: Deborah Szapiro, Andrew Horne and Lilyfield Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Great moments in science: presented by Dr Karl Kruszelnicki”.
It is safer for a cat to fall from a thirty-two story building than a seven story building and testing these things are easy in the ready made environment of New York and its high rise. It is said that one hundred and thirty two cats in five months fall from high rise buildings. Lots of information has been gathered, and it had been found that ninety percent of cats survive. In fact, the higher the building, the higher the chance of survival, the shorter the distance, the greater the chance of broken bones. Find out more in this animation, it is very interesting.

results.title: Fallen angels
results.creator_credit: Jeff Lau, Jet Tone Production and Wong
results.brief_description: Fallen Angels is another breathtaking film from Hong Kong director Wong Kar Wai. The film stylishly weaves the stories of a group of characters who traverse Hong Kong city by night. Wong Chi-Ming (Leon Lai) is a hired killer. His partner is an un-named woman (Michelle Reis) whom he has never seen. A young man who doesn’t speak (Takeshi Kaneshiro) videos his father in their tiny Hong Kong flat. Hong Kong, the city, is itself a ‘character’ in the strange meanderings of the stories. Wong Kar Wai (together with Australian cinematographer Chris Doyle) creates a visually stunning, edgy style which none the less is as much about the characters drawn together as cinematic effects. In Cantonese with English subtitles.

results.title: Fallen
results.creator_credit: Turner Pictures, Atlas Entertainment, Charles Rover, Dawn Steel and Gregory Hoblit
results.brief_description: High budget supernatural thriller that sees Joe Hobbs (Denzel Washington) witness the execution of a serial killer. Things take a menacing turn when identical murders take place. It appears that a demon is passing through humans possessing them thus enabling the killer to continue with his murdering. Taunting the detective a twist at the end keeps the drama gripping. Police drama meets supernatural thriller. Cast includes John Goodman, Donald Sutherland and James Gandolfini.

results.title: Fall line
results.creator_credit: Pyramid Films, Bob Carmichael and Greg Lowe
results.brief_description: An exciting film of the high risk sport of extreme skiing. On a peak in Wyoming’s Grand Tetons a lone skier attempts the first climb and then the fall line - a breathtaking descent of the almost vertical slope. Awarded first prize, Sports, San Francisco International Film Festival. The skier is Steve Shea and the film has been narrated by Ron Hayes.

results.title: Fall-line
results.brief_description: Compares the similarities of handling body movement in four sports which have been made posible by new technology: skateboarding, surfing, skiing and hang gliding. Additional script material by Bert Deling.

results.title: Falklands: the story
results.brief_description: British whaling stations and meteorological outposts have operated in the Falklands for the past 40 years, but recently Argentina and Chile claimed the Islands on the basis of their geographical proximity.

results.title: Fakes and drives
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Basketball Skills”.
One in a series of films on basketball skills, giving instruction and demonstration of basketball techniques, including slow-motion action and training routines. Narrated by Ron Pickering.

results.title: Faithless = Trolosa [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Kaj Larsen, SVT Drama, Ab Svensk Film Industri, Sf Norge As, YLE, Liv Ullman and Ingmar Bergman
results.brief_description: Liv Ullman, best known for her acting in iconic films by Ingmar Bergman, directs “Faithless”, from a script by Bergman. “Faithless” is the story of a bourgeois Swedish family whose lives are put asunder by an extra-marital affair. Marianne (Lena Andre) is happily married to composer Markus (Thomas Hanzon), living with their young daughter, Isabelle. David (Krister Henriksson), a friend to both Marianne and Markus, is a hapless writer and theatre director, onto his troubled second marriage, and a frequent visitor to the family home. David is depicted as a charming rogue with a self-destructive streak, filled with self-loathing. One night, when Markus is away on tour, David proposes to Marianne that they sleep together. Marianne refuses but her interest is piqued and the sanctity of her family unit is doomed. Told in extended flashback sequences, Marianne relays her story to the narrator, Bergman (Erland Josephson), who listens patiently, coercing Marianne to confess her indiscretions. This set-up, at a beautiful, remote beachside retreat, is reminiscent of many Ingmar Bergman films, in particular “Persona”. “Faithless” employs a leisurely pace to unfurl this tale of morality, betrayal, love and revenge, between three consenting adults and an innocent child. In Swedish with English subtitles.

results.title: Faithful departed
results.creator_credit: Des Hickey, B.A.C. Films Ltd (Ireland) and Kieran Hickey
results.brief_description: Life in Dublin in the early years of the 20th Century as shown in selected contemporary photographs. Discusses James Joyce’s early life and shows the setting of his novel Ulysses in the city as he knew it. Commentary by Jack MacGowran.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Des Hickey, B.A.C. Films Ltd (Ireland) and Kieran Hickey
